H0.text: John Calvin, 16th century French theologian, was the autocrat of which city for 13 years, where he improved the city and provided harsh punishments for moral transgressions. Geneva

H1.text: John Calvin, 16th century French theologian, was the autocrat of which city for 13 years, where he improved the city and provided harsh punishments for moral transgressions. Lyon

H2.text: John Calvin, 16th century French theologian, was the autocrat of which city for 13 years, where he improved the city and provided harsh punishments for moral transgressions. Strasbourg

H3.text: John Calvin, 16th century French theologian, was the autocrat of which city for 13 years, where he improved the city and provided harsh punishments for moral transgressions. GÉ›nf

A4.text: John Calvin became the spiritual leader of Geneva in 1541.

A5.text: Michael Servetus was arrested in Geneva and burnt at the stake as a heretic by order of the city's Protestant governing council, and John Calvin and his followers denounced him.
